description: Verify that the test execution page loads correctly with proper authentication and test plan data
scenario: Admin user navigates to execute a specific test plan using the execution functionality
expected_results: Display the test execution page with test information, progress tracker, and result form
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to test plans list
3. Click execute button for an existing test plan
4. Verify page loads at /admin/system-test/test-plans/{id}/execute
5. Check header shows 'Execute Test Plan' with test plan number and module
6. Verify all sections are displayed: test information, procedure steps, and result form

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the test execution functionality
scenario: Regular user attempts to access test execution functionality directly
expected_results: Access should be denied with 403 Forbidden error for non-admin users
procedure:
1. Log in as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans/1/execute
3. Verify 403 Forbidden error is returned
4. Check redirect to appropriate error page
5. Ensure no test execution interface is accessible

description: Verify proper error handling when attempting to execute a non-existent test plan
scenario: Admin attempts to execute a test plan that doesn't exist in the system
expected_results: Display 404 Not Found error when test plan ID doesn't exist
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans/99999/execute (non-existent ID)
3. Verify 404 Not Found error is returned
4. Check appropriate error page is displayed
5. Ensure no execution interface is rendered for invalid test plan ID

description: Verify the page header displays correct execution context with test plan details
scenario: Admin views execution page header to understand which test plan is being executed
expected_results: Display header with 'Execute Test Plan' title and test plan number with module name
procedure:
1. Navigate to execute page for test plan STP-001-01
2. Check title shows 'Execute Test Plan'
3. Verify description shows test plan number and module name
4. Confirm 'Back to Test Plan' button navigates to view test plan page
5. Check proper styling and fade-in animation

description: Verify the test information section displays all relevant test plan details
scenario: Admin views test information to understand test objectives before execution
expected_results: Display test information with all fields: test plan number, module, description, scenario, and expected results
procedure:
1. Navigate to test execution page
2. Locate test information section with blue border
3. Verify test plan number and module are displayed in grid layout
4. Check description is shown clearly
5. Confirm scenario is displayed if available
6. Verify expected results are prominently shown

description: Verify the test procedure section displays steps with progress tracking
scenario: Admin views procedure steps and tracks completion progress during execution
expected_results: Display procedure steps with checkboxes, progress counter, and visual progress bar
procedure:
1. Locate test procedure section
2. Verify progress header shows 'Progress: 0 / X' where X is total steps
3. Check progress bar is displayed with 0% width initially
4. Confirm each procedure step has a checkbox and step text
5. Verify steps are formatted with proper styling and borders

description: Verify procedure step checkboxes update progress tracking correctly
scenario: Admin checks off completed steps during test execution
expected_results: Checking steps updates progress counter, progress bar, and visual feedback
procedure:
1. Check first procedure step checkbox
2. Verify completed steps counter increases (0/X becomes 1/X)
3. Check progress bar width increases proportionally
4. Confirm step background changes to green when checked
5. Uncheck step and verify counter and progress bar decrease

description: Verify progress bar changes color based on completion percentage
scenario: Admin completes various percentages of steps and observes visual feedback
expected_results: Progress bar shows blue (0-49%), yellow (50-99%), and green (100%) colors
procedure:
1. Check steps to reach different completion percentages
2. Verify progress bar is blue when less than 50% complete
3. Check progress bar turns yellow when 50% or more complete
4. Confirm progress bar turns green when 100% complete
5. Test transitions between color states

description: Verify test result buttons (Pass, Fail, Skip) function correctly
scenario: Admin selects test result status after executing test procedures
expected_results: Result buttons show visual selection state and update hidden form field
procedure:
1. Click 'Pass' button
2. Verify button shows ring selection indicator
3. Check hidden test_status field is set to 'passed'
4. Click 'Fail' button and verify selection changes
5. Click 'Skip' button and verify selection changes
6. Confirm only one button can be selected at a time

description: Verify failure reason textarea appears when test is marked as failed
scenario: Admin marks test as failed and provides failure reason
expected_results: Failure reason textarea becomes visible and required when status is failed
procedure:
1. Click 'Fail' button
2. Verify failure reason textarea becomes visible
3. Check textarea is marked as required
4. Enter failure reason text
5. Switch to 'Pass' status and verify textarea becomes hidden
6. Confirm textarea value is cleared when hidden

description: Verify submit button is enabled only when test status is selected
scenario: Admin observes submit button state based on form completion
expected_results: Submit button is disabled initially and enabled when test status is selected
procedure:
1. Verify 'Submit Result' button is disabled initially
2. Select any test status (Pass, Fail, Skip)
3. Check submit button becomes enabled
4. Verify button shows save icon and proper text
5. Confirm button styling is appropriate

description: Verify form validation prevents submission without required fields
scenario: Admin attempts to submit form with missing required information
expected_results: Form validation prevents submission and shows appropriate alerts
procedure:
1. Attempt to submit form without selecting status
2. Verify alert 'Please select a test result status.'
3. Select 'Fail' status but leave failure reason empty
4. Attempt submission and verify alert about failure reason
5. Confirm form submission is prevented in both cases

description: Verify successful test execution submission saves data and redirects appropriately
scenario: Admin completes test execution and submits result successfully
expected_results: Test execution is saved to database and user is redirected to view test plan page
procedure:
1. Complete test execution with valid data
2. Select test status and provide failure reason if needed
3. Submit form successfully
4. Verify POST request to /admin/system-test/test-plans/{id}/execute
5. Check test execution data is saved (status, date, executed_by, failure_reason)
6. Confirm redirect to view test plan page with success message

description: Verify confirmation dialog appears before final submission
scenario: Admin submits test result and expects confirmation before saving
expected_results: Confirmation dialog shows selected status before final submission
procedure:
1. Complete test execution form
2. Select test status
3. Click 'Submit Result' button
4. Verify confirmation dialog appears
5. Check dialog message shows selected status (PASSED/FAILED/SKIPPED)
6. Test both confirm and cancel options

description: Verify proper error handling when test execution submission fails
scenario: Test execution submission encounters server-side errors
expected_results: Display appropriate error messages and maintain form state
procedure:
1. Simulate server error during test execution submission
2. Submit valid form data
3. Verify error flash message is displayed
4. Check that form data is preserved after error
5. Confirm error is logged on server side

description: Verify that CSRF token is properly included and validated during execution submission
scenario: Test execution form submission includes proper CSRF protection against attacks
expected_results: CSRF token is present in form and validated on submission
procedure:
1. Check form includes hidden CSRF token field
2. Verify token value is properly generated
3. Test form submission with valid token succeeds
4. Attempt submission without token and verify rejection
5. Confirm CSRF protection doesn't interfere with legitimate execution

description: Verify the execution page layout adapts properly to different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses test execution page on various devices and screen sizes
expected_results: Page layout adapts properly with responsive grid system
procedure:
1. View page on desktop (1920x1080) - verify 2-column layout
2. Test on tablet view (768px width) - check layout adaptation
3. Check mobile view (375px width) - verify single column stacking
4. Confirm lg:col-span-2 behavior for main content
5. Verify all sections remain accessible and functional on all screen sizes

description: Verify that browser page title shows 'Execute Test Plan'
scenario: Admin views browser tab title to understand current page context
expected_results: Browser tab shows 'Execute Test Plan' title
procedure:
1. Navigate to test execution page
2. Check browser tab title shows 'Execute Test Plan'
3. Verify title is clear and descriptive
4. Confirm title helps with browser history and bookmarking
5. Check title distinguishes from other admin pages

description: Verify proper integration with test management navigation workflow
scenario: Admin navigates to and from execution page as part of test management workflow
expected_results: Test execution integrates seamlessly with test management navigation
procedure:
1. Navigate to execution from test plan view page
2. Use 'Back to Test Plan' button to return
3. Navigate to execution from test plans list
4. Test integration with other admin pages
5. Verify all navigation maintains proper context

description: Verify test execution functionality works across different web browsers
scenario: Admin accesses test execution using various browsers to ensure cross-browser compatibility
expected_results: Test execution functionality works correctly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge
procedure:
1. Test execution page in Google Chrome (latest version)
2. Verify functionality in Mozilla Firefox
3. Check display and features in Safari (if available)
4. Test in Microsoft Edge browser
5. Confirm all JavaScript features (progress, form) work in each browser

description: Verify that test execution page displays correctly in both light and dark themes
scenario: Admin switches between light and dark modes to ensure proper theming support
expected_results: All page elements display with appropriate colors and contrast in both themes
procedure:
1. View execution page in light mode
2. Switch to dark mode (if theme toggle available)
3. Verify all text remains readable with proper contrast
4. Check form sections use appropriate dark theme colors
5. Confirm progress elements adapt to theme

description: Verify that test execution page meets accessibility standards for screen readers and keyboard navigation
scenario: Admin and accessibility tools test page for compliance with accessibility standards
expected_results: Page is fully accessible via keyboard navigation and screen readers
procedure:
1. Navigate entire page using only keyboard (Tab, Enter, arrows)
2. Test with screen reader for proper label reading
3. Verify focus indicators are visible on all interactive elements
4. Check checkboxes and buttons are properly announced
5. Confirm proper semantic HTML structure and ARIA labels

description: Verify that test execution page performs efficiently with interactive elements
scenario: Admin measures execution page performance including form responsiveness
expected_results: Page maintains responsive performance with smooth interactions
procedure:
1. Measure page load time
2. Check JavaScript performance with multiple step checkboxes
3. Verify form submission performance
4. Confirm no memory leaks during test sessions

description: Verify that execution data is properly tracked and saved to database
scenario: Admin executes test and verifies all execution metadata is properly recorded
expected_results: Execution data includes timestamp, executor, status, and failure reason if applicable
procedure:
1. Execute test plan with specific status
2. Submit test result
3. Verify execution_date is recorded
4. Check executed_by field contains current admin username
5. Confirm test_status is updated correctly
6. Verify failure_reason is saved only for failed tests

description: Verify complete test execution workflow from navigation through result submission
scenario: Admin completes entire test execution workflow including progress tracking and result submission
expected_results: Complete workflow provides seamless test execution experience with proper tracking and feedback
procedure:
1. Navigate to execution from test plan view
2. Review test information and procedure steps
3. Begin test execution
4. Check off procedure steps as completed
5. Monitor progress bar and counter updates
6. Select test result status (Pass/Fail/Skip)
7. Provide failure reason if test failed
8. Submit result with confirmation
9. Verify redirect to test plan view with updated status and success message
10. Confirm all execution data is properly saved and displayed
